revision.text:
{{Infobox football biography | name = Luciano Vietto | image = | caption = | fullname = Luciano Darío Vietto{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/844127 |title=2018/19 Premier League squads confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=3 September 2018 |accessdate=4 September 2018}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1993|12|5|df=y}} | birth_place = Balnearia, Argentina | height = 1.74 m | position = [[Forward (association football)#Striker|Striker]] | currentclub = [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]]
(on loan from [[Atletico Madrid]]) | clubnumber = 19 | youthclubs1 = Independiente Balnearia | youthclubs2 = [[Estudiantes de La Plata|Estudiantes]] | youthyears1 = 2000–2008 | youthyears2 = 2008–2010 | youthyears3 = 2010–2011 | youthclubs3 = [[Racing Club de Avellaneda|Racing Club]] | clubs1 = [[Racing Club de Avellaneda|Racing Club]] | years1 = 2011–2014 | caps1 = 69 | goals1 = 18 | years2 = 2014–2015 | clubs2 = [[Villarreal CF|Villarreal]] | caps2 = 32 | goals2 = 12 | years3 = 2015– | clubs3 = [[Atlético Madrid]] | caps3 = 25 | goals3 = 1 | years4 = 2016–2017 | clubs4 = → [[Sevilla FC|Sevilla]] (loan) | caps4 = 21 | goals4 = 6 | years5 = 2018 | clubs5 = → [[Valencia CF|Valencia]] (loan) | caps5 = 13 | goals5 = 2 | years6 = 2018– | clubs6 = → [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] (loan) | caps6 = 17 | goals6 = 1 | nationalteam1 = [[Argentina national under-20 football team|Argentina U20]] | nationalyears1 = 2013 | nationalcaps1 = 4 | nationalgoals1 = 2 | club-update = 08:57, 10 February 2019 (UTC) | ntupdate = 19 February 2013 }} '''Luciano Darío Vietto''' ({{IPA-es|luˈsjano ðaˈɾi.o ˈβjeto|am}};{{efn-ua|In isolation, ''Darío'' and ''Vietto'' are pronounced {{IPA-es|daˈɾi.o|}} and {{IPA-es|ˈbjeto|}} respectively.}} born 5 December 1993) is an [[Argentina|Argentine]] professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for [[Premier League]] side [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]], on loan from [[Atletico Madrid]]. ==Club career== ===Early career=== Vietto was born in the small town of Balnearia in the [[Córdoba Province, Argentina|Province of Córdoba]]. He joined his local team Independiente de Balnearia at the age of seven. At the age of 15, Vietto joined [[Argentine Primera División]] club [[Estudiantes de La Plata|Estudiantes]],{{cite web|url=http://pensionpincha.blogspot.ca/2008/04/luciano-vietto.html|title=Pensión de Estudiantes de La Plata: Luicano Vietto|trans-title=Board of Estudiantes de La Plata: Luciano Vietto|publisher=Pensión Del Pincha|language=es|date=25 August 2008|accessdate=6 August 2014}} but was released two years later. He subsequently moved to [[Racing Club de Avellaneda|Racing Club]]'s youth academy, after a failed trial at [[Rosario Central]].{{cite web|url=http://canchallena.lanacion.com.ar/1515212-vietto-la-joya-de-racing-que-estuvo-cerca-de-dejar-el-futbol|title=Vietto, la joya de Racing, que estuvo cerca de dejar el fútbol|trans-title=Vietto, Racing's pearl, who almost left football|publisher=Cancha Llena|language=es|date=7 October 2012|accessdate=10 August 2014}} ===Racing Club=== In 2011 Vietto signed his first professional contract, and was called up to the main squad by manager [[Diego Simeone]] on 25 October.{{cite web|url=http://www.ole.com.ar/racing/Vietto-creer_0_578942367.html|title=Vietto para creer|trans-title=''Vietto'' to believe|publisher=[[Olé (sports newspaper)|Olé]]|language=es|date=25 October 2011|accessdate=10 August 2014}} He made his professional debut on a day later, coming on as a late [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] in a 1–1 home draw against [[Club Atlético Lanús|Lanús]].{{cite web|url=http://www.espndeportes.com/futbol/cronica?id=325703&league=ARG.1|title=Racing igualó con Lanús y está más lejos de Boca|trans-title=Racing draws with Lanús and is farther of Boca|publisher=[[ESPN Deportes]]|language=es|date=26 October 2011|accessdate=10 August 2014}} Vietto was handed his first start on 3 September 2012, scoring his first professional goals (and his first [[hat-trick]]) in a 3–1 home success over [[San Martín de San Juan]].{{cite web|url=http://www.espndeportes.com/futbol/cronica?id=352350&league=ARG.1|title=Racing le ganó a San Martín y quedó a un punto de Boca|trans-title=Racing defeated San Martin and ended up a point behind Boca|publisher=ESPN Deportes|language=es|date=3 September 2012|accessdate=10 August 2014}} He became a regular starter under [[Luis Zubeldía]] and contributed with 13 goals during [[2012–13 Argentine Primera División season|the campaign]], as his side only finished fifth.{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/player/168277/luciano-vietto?season=2012|title=Luciano Vietto – 2012 season|publisher=[[ESPN FC]]|accessdate=7 August 2014}} After attracting interest from European clubs such as [[Premier League]] club [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] and [[Serie A]] champions [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]],{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2201987/Liverpool-eye-Argentinian-starlet-Luciano-Vietto.html|title=Liverpool rival Juventus for Argentinian starlet Vietto|website=[[Daily Mail]]|date=12 September 2012|accessdate=7 August 2014}} Vietto signed a four-year contract extension with Racing on 26 March 2013.{{cite web|url=http://www.racingclub.com.ar/plantel/nota/2013/03/1241_vietto-acordo-la-extension-de-su-contrato-con-el-club/|title=Vietto acordó la extensión de su contrato con el club|trans-title=Vietto agreed to a contract extension with the club|publisher=Racing Club's official website|language=es|date=26 March 2013|accessdate=7 August 2013}} Vietto appeared in 35 matches in [[2013–14 Argentine Primera División season|2013–14]], scoring five times. Highlights included a brace in a 3–1 away win against [[Club de Gimnasia y Esgrima La Plata|Gimansia La Plata]] on 2 November 2013.{{cite web|url=http://espndeportes.espn.go.com/futbol/cronica/_/id/373353|title=Racing logró su segundo triunfo en fila frente a Gimnasia|trans-title=Racing achieved its second successive triumph against Gimnasia|publisher=ESPN Deportes|language=es|date=2 November 2013|accessdate=22 March 2015}} ===Villarreal=== [[File:UEFA Euro League FC Salzburg gegen Villarreal 10.JPG|thumb|right|Vietto (3rd from left) lining up alongside his [[Villarreal CF|Villarreal]] teammates in 2015]] On 4 August 2014, Vietto signed a five-year deal with [[La Liga]] side [[Villarreal CF]],{{cite web|url=http://www.villarrealcf.es/noticias/portada-ultimas-novedades/item/6240-el-villarreal-ficha-al-delantero-luciano-vietto |title=El Villarreal CF ficha a Luciano Vietto |trans-title=Villarreal CF signs Luciano Vietto |publisher=Villarreal's official website |language=es |date=4 August 2014 |accessdate=10 August 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140808051409/http://www.villarrealcf.es/noticias/portada-ultimas-novedades/item/6240-el-villarreal-ficha-al-delantero-luciano-vietto |archivedate=8 August 2014 |df= }} for a rumoured [[Euro|€]]5.5 million fee.{{cite web|url=http://www.marca.com/2014/08/04/futbol/equipos/villarreal/1407180982.html|title=El Villarreal ficha a Luciano Vietto por cinco temporadas|trans-title=Villarreal signs Luciano Vietto for five seasons|publisher=[[Marca (newspaper)|Marca]]|language=es|date=4 August 2014|accessdate=10 August 2014}} He made his debut for the club on the 21st, coming on as a second-half substitute for [[Ikechukwu Uche]] in a 3–0 [[2014–15 UEFA Europa League qualifying phase and play-off round#Play-off round|Europa League play-off]] victory over [[FC Astana|Astana]],{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2015/matches/round=2000586/match=2015117/index.html|title=Astana 0–3 Villarreal|publisher=UEFA.com|date=21 August 2014|accessdate=22 March 2015}} before scoring twice in the return leg at home.{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2015/matches/round=2000586/match=2015148/index.html|title=Villarreal 4–0 Astana|publisher=UEFA.com|date=28 August 2014|accessdate=22 March 2015}} Vietto made his La Liga debut on 24 August, replacing [[Giovani dos Santos]] for the last 10 minutes of a 2–0 away win against [[Valencian Community|Valencian]] rivals [[Levante UD]].{{cite news|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/322141/report|title=La Liga: Ikechukwu Uche and Denis Cheryshev were on-target as Villarreal began their campaign with a 2-0 win at Levante|publisher=[[Sky Sports]]|date=24 August 2014|accessdate=5 January 2015}} On 21 September he scored his first goals in the competition, netting a brace in a 4–2 home win over [[Rayo Vallecano]].{{cite web|url=http://www.marca.com/eventos/marcador/futbol/2014_15/primera/jornada_4/vil_ray/|title=El Villarreal llega a tiempo|trans-title=Villarreal arrives in time|publisher=Marca|language=es|date=21 September 2014|accessdate=22 March 2015}} Vietto added another double on 21 December, in a 3–0 win against the [[Deportivo de La Coruña]] also at the [[Estadio El Madrigal]].{{cite news|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/322283/report|title=Primera Division: Luciano Vietto scored twice as Villarreal beat Deportivo 3-0|publisher=Sky Sports|date=21 December 2014|accessdate=5 January 2015}} He finished the month with three goals, with his side moving to sixth position, and earning him the honour of [[La Liga Player of the Month]].{{cite news|url=http://www.lfp.es/en/news/the-bbva-prizes-for-decembers-best|title=The BBVA Prizes for December's best|publisher=[[Liga de Fútbol Profesional]]|date=14 January 2015|accessdate=14 January 2015}} ===Atlético Madrid=== On 22 June 2015, Villarreal confirmed Vietto had joined [[Atlético Madrid]] for a fee reported to be in the region of €20 million.{{cite web|title=Acuerdo con el Villarreal para el traspaso de Vietto|url=http://clubatleticodemadrid.com/noticias/vietto-ya-es-rojiblanco|website=clubatleticodemadrid.com|publisher=Atletico Madrid|accessdate=7 July 2015|language=es|date=7 July 2015}}{{cite news|url=http://au.eurosport.com/football/la-liga/2011-2012/vietto-joins-atletico_sto4792562/story.shtml|title=Luciano Vietto joins Atletico Madrid|publisher=EuroSport.com|date=22 June 2015}} Vietto scored his first goal for Atlético on 4 October 2015 as he tapped in a cross from [[Jackson Martínez]] to equalize against archrivals [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] in a league match that eventually ended 1–1. ====Sevilla (loan)==== On 30 July 2016, Atlético Madrid and [[Sevilla FC|Sevilla]] reached an agreement for the loan of Vietto with an option to buy.{{cite web|url=http://en.atleticodemadrid.com/noticias/agreement-with-sevilla-fc-for-the-loan-of-vietto|title=Agreement with Sevilla FC for the loan of Vietto|website=Atlético Madrid|access-date=30 July 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://www.sevillafc.es/actualidad/noticias/sevilla-fc-y-atletico-cierran-la-cesion-con-opcion-compra-de-vietto-y-el-0 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20160730115226/http://www.sevillafc.es/actualidad/noticias/sevilla-fc-y-atletico-cierran-la-cesion-con-opcion-compra-de-vietto-y-el-0 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=30 July 2016 |title=Sevilla FC y Atlético cierran la cesión con opción a compra de Vietto y el traspaso de Gameiro |trans-title=Sevilla FC and Atlético reached an agreement for the transfer of Vietto and Gameiro |language=Spanish |website=Sevilla FC |access-date=30 July 2016 }} ====Valencia (loan)==== On 4 January 2018, Vietto signed a loan deal with [[Valencia CF|Valencia]] for the remainder of the season with an option to buy in the summer.{{cite web|url=http://en.valenciacf.com/ver/77470/comunicado-oficial-l-luciano-vietto.html|title=Club Statement Luciano Vietto|website=Valencia CF|access-date=4 January 2018}} Vietto made his debut against Girona coming on as a sub. In a Copa Del Rey fixture against Las Palmas, Vietto scored his first ever [[hat-trick]] in Spain. ====Fulham (loan)==== On 9 August 2018 he joined English Premier League club Fulham on a season long loan.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45084054 |title=Fulham: Andre-Frank Anguissa, Joe Bryan, Sergio Rico and Luciano Vietto set to join |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 August 2018 |accessdate=9 August 2018}} ==International career== ===Youth teams=== On 9 January 2013, Vietto made his international debut for the [[Argentina national under-20 football team|Argentina national under-20 team]] against [[Chile national under-20 football team|Chile]] at [[2013 South American Youth Championship|the year]]'s [[South American Youth Championship]].{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/gamecast/358963/gamecast.html|title=Argentina U20 v Chile U20|publisher=ESPN FC|date=9 January 2013|accessdate=8 August 2014}} He scored his first goal four days later, but in a 1–2 loss against [[Paraguay national under-20 football team|Paraguay]], and finished the tournament with two goals in four games. ==Career statistics== {{Updated|match played 29 January 2019|[http://www.espnfc.us/player/168277/luciano-vietto]}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |+ Appearances and goals by club, season and competition |- !rowspan=2 width=140|Club !rowspan=2|Season !colspan=3|League !colspan=2|National Cup !colspan=2|Continental !colspan=2|Total |- !Division !width=40|Apps!!width=40|Goals !width=40|Apps!!width=40|Goals División|Primera División]] |2||0||1||0||colspan=2|—||3||0 |- |[[2012–13 Argentine Primera División season|2012–13]] |Primera División |32||13||1||0||1||0||34||13 |- |[[2013–14 Argentine Primera División season|2013–14]] |Primera División |35||5||0||0||1||0||36||5 |- !colspan=2|Total !69!!18!!2!!0!!2!!0!!73!!18 |- |rowspan=2|[[Villarreal CF|Villarreal]] |[[2014–15 Villarreal CF season|2014–15]] |[[La Liga]] |32||12||4||0||12||8||48||20 |- !colspan=2|Total !32!!12!!4!!0!!12!!8!!48!!20 |- |rowspan=3|[[Atlético Madrid]] |[[2015–16 Atlético Madrid season|2015–16]] |La Liga |19||1||4||1||5||1||28||3 |- |[[2017–18 Atlético Madrid season|2017–18]] |La Liga |6||0||2||1||2||0||10||1 |- !colspan=2|Total !25!!1!!6!!2!!7!!1!!38!!4 |- |rowspan=2|[[Sevilla FC|Sevilla]] (loan) |[[2016–17 Sevilla FC season|2016–17]] |La Liga |21||6||5||3||5||1||31||10 |- !colspan=2|Total !21!!6!!5!!3!!5!!1!!31!!10 |- |rowspan=2|[[Valencia CF|Valencia]] (loan) |[[2017–18 Valencia CF season|2017–18]] |La Liga |13||2||5||3||colspan=2|–||18||5 |- !colspan=2|Total !13!!2!!5!!3!!colspan=2|–!!18!!5 |- |rowspan="2"|[[Fulham FC|Fulham]] (loan) |[[2018–19 Premier League|2018–19]] |rowspan="1"|[[Premier League]] |15||1||1||0||colspan=2|–|||16||1 |- !colspan="2"|Total !15!!1!!1!!0!!colspan=2|–!!16!!1 |- !colspan="3"|Career total !175!!40!!23!!8!!26!!10!!224!!58 |} {{notelist}} ==Honours== ===Club=== ;Atletico Madrid *[[UEFA Champions League]]: Runner-up [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League|2015–16]] ;Individual *[[La Liga Player of the Month]]: December 2014 * [[UEFA Europa
